availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Spencer (Adair County, Kentucky, druggist and soldier)

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, druggist and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Eliza S. Spencer. Father of William G. Spencer. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as adjutant, major, lieutenant colonel, and colonel from October 9, 1861 to April 3, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Columbia, p. 95.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 176.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Application #1030397, Certificate #733985.
